interestingFact: The Eiffel Tower in Paris was originally intended to be a temporary structure for the 1889 World's Fair.
Japan is made up of over 6,800 islands, with Honshu being the largest.
Nepal is home to Mount Everest, the world’s highest peak, standing at 8,848 meters.
Australia is the only continent covered by a single country.
Brazil is home to the Amazon Rainforest, which produces about 20% of the world's oxygen.
Canada has the longest coastline in the world, stretching over 202,000 kilometers.
India is the world’s largest democracy and the birthplace of four major religions.
Italy has more UNESCO World Heritage sites than any other country in the world.
The U.S. is the third-largest country in both land area and population.
China’s Great Wall is the only man-made structure visible from space with the naked eye.
Big Ben actually refers to the bell inside the clock tower, not the tower itself.
Germany is famous for its autobahns, some of which have no official speed limit.
